result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert D Dickinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court orders Mr. Dickinson to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443 per count totalling $1329,  within 30 days; non-payment shall result in a 20 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive; this may also be served in Kenosha Co.

Per 8/29/16 Court Order Defendant to pay $10 Drug Offender Diversion Surcharge.

On Count #4: The Court sentences Defendant to serve 20  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence on or before 10/20/2016.

Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

The Court authorizes service of this sentences to Kenosha and/or Milwaukee County, but it must be served as 'real time' as would be in Jefferson County

Defendant Robert D Dickinson in court with Attorney Preston James Smead.  Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance 

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Dickinson
The Court questions Mr. Dickinson

On Count #4: The Court sentences Defendant to serve 20  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence on or before 10/20/2016.


On Count #7: The Court sentences Defendant to serve 20  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to be served consecutive to the sentence in Count #4


On Count #9: The Court sentences Defendant to serve 20  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to be served consecutive to the sentence in Count #7

The Court authorizes service of this sentences to Kenosha and/or Milwaukee County, but it must be served as 'real time' as would be in Jefferson County

The Court orders Mr. Dickinson to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443 per count totalling $1329,  within 30 days; non-payment shall result in a 20 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive; this may also be served in Kenosha Co.

--0 days credit for time already served given

recess: 1:51pm
Characters Submitted by Attorney Smead on behalf of Mr. Dickinson (4 letters)
Sentencing hearing on August 22, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
with Elements

[MK] case called at 9:25am.
Defendant Robert D Dickinson in court with Attorney Preston James Smead.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance. 
ADA Teuber recites the Plea Agreement of the parties:  the State will motion for the Party to A Crime language to be stricken from Counts #4, #7, and #9, and the Defendant will change his plea to those counts. Upon acceptance of such pleas, the State will motion for read-in and dismissal of the remaining counts.  The parties will jointly recommend that the Court withhold sentence and place the Defendant on Probation for two years with a condition of sixty days conditional jail time with work-release. The Defense will be free to argue the length of the conditional jail term.  The recommendations for other terms and conditions of Probation will be outlined at the time of the sentencing hearing. 
recess 9:36am, reconvene 9:43am.

On Motion of the State, the Court strikes the Party to the Crime charging language from Counts #4, #7, and #9.  

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " Guilty " entered on Counts #4, #7, #9; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses the remaining Counts. The Court verifies with Mr. Dickinson that Mr. Dickinson understands that the State may request payment of restitution in regard to the read-in Counts.  

On request of the Defense, the Court will schedule sentencing on a later date.
recess 9:50am. 
[post hearing/off record Mr. Dickinson verified to the clerk that the Mitchell Street, Milwaukee address remains current.] 

NEXT:  Sentencing on August 22nd at 1:00pm.
